JK Kunjungi Ponpes di Bekasi, Beri Pesan Khusus ke Santri Papua
01 Nov 2019, 01:39 by Jabbar Ramdhani
Jakarta -
Wakil Presiden ke-12 RI Jusuf Kalla (JK) mengunjungi Pondok Pesantren Nuu Waar Al Fatih Kaffah Nusantara (AFKN) Hafiz Quran dan Hadist di Kabupaten Bekasi. JK berpesan kepada para santri untuk rajin menimba ilmu di pondok pesantren.
Secara khusus, JK memberi pesan kepada santri asal Papua. Untuk diketahui, Pondok Pesantren Nuu Waar Al Fatih Kaffah Nusantara mempunyai 750 santri yang 95 persennya berasal dari Papua.
"Kalian para santri asal Papua, akan menjadi pelopor-pelopor di daerah, untuk itu saya ingin menyampaikan bahwa kalian selama belajar di pondok ini agar belajar dengan serius dan menimba ilmu sebanyak-banyaknya selama belajar di pondok ini," kata JK seperti dalam keterangan tertulis yang diterima detikcom, Kamis (31/10/2019).


JK berunjung ke Pondok Pesantren Nuu Waar Al Fatih Kaffah Nusantara, Bekasi. (Foto: Dok. Istimewa)

Para santri Papua dididik di pesantren ini secara gratis dan diharapkan saat kembali ke daerahnya dapat menjadi pelopor bagi masyarakat asal mereka. Dalam kunjungannya JK didampingi pemimpin ponpes, Ustaz Fadlan Garamatan.
JK mengatakan dirinya baru pertama kali mengunjungi pesantren yang berlokasi di Kampung Bunut, Desa Tamansari, Kecamatan Setu, Kabupaten Bekasi, Jawa Barat, ini. Sebelumnya dia sempat beberapa kali dijadwalkan namun batal.
"Saya merasa bersyukur karena akhirnya dapat mengunjungi pondok ini, setelah beberapa kali direncanakan" ucap JK.

JK Visits Ponpes in Bekasi, Gives Special Message to Santri Papua
Nov 01 2019, 01:39 by Jabbar Ramdhani
Jakarta -
Indonesian 12th Vice President Jusuf Kalla (JK) visited the Islamic Boarding School of Nuu Waar Al Fatih Kaffah Nusantara (AFKN) Hafiz Quran and Hadith in Bekasi Regency. JK advised the students to study diligently in the Islamic boarding school.
Specifically, JK gave a message to students from Papua. To note, Nuu Waar Al Fatih Kaffah Nusantara Islamic Boarding School has 750 students, 95 percent of whom are from Papua.
"You students from Papua, will be the pioneers in the area, for that I want to say that you all while studying at this cottage so that you study seriously and gain as much knowledge as you can while studying at this cottage," JK said as in a written statement received by AFP on Thursday (10/31/2019).


JK visited the Islamic Boarding School Nuu Waar Al Fatih Kaffah Nusantara, Bekasi. (Photo: Special Doc.)

Papuan students are educated in this pesantren free of charge and it is hoped that when they return to their area they will be a pioneer for their home community. During his visit JK was accompanied by the leader of the Islamic Boarding School, Ustaz Fadlan Garamatan.
JK said that this was the first time he visited a pesantren located in Kampung Bunut, Tamansari Village, Setu District, Bekasi Regency, West Java. Previously he had several times scheduled but canceled.
"I feel grateful that I have finally been able to visit this lodge, after several planned attempts," said JK.
